40.text: WA Department of Industry and Resources

text:
1:250 000 map sheet: Marble Bar SF 50-08; Roy Hill SF 50-12 
 1:100 000 map sheet: Mount Marsh 2753; Tambourah 2754  
 Target Commodity: Au, Ni, Cu, Pb, Zn  
 Keywords: Satellite imagery, stream and rock-chip sampling,  
 Prospects drilled: Nil  
 Location: The Western Shaw Project is 100 km southwest of the town of Marble Bar in the Pilbara 
 on the Mount Marsh and Tambourah 1:100,000 map sheets.  
 Geology: The project covers the southern part of the Western Shaw greenstone belt. The main rock 
 types  in  the  area  comprised  mafic  volcanic  rocks  inter-layered  with  subordinate  ultramafic  rocks, 
 chert/quartzite and banded iron-formation.  
 Work  done:  Exploration  in  2007  comprised  acquisition  and  interpretation  of  satellite  imagery  and 
 data capture and interpretation of previous explorers work.  
 Results:  Analysis  of  the  historical  geochemical  data  indicates  an  untested  stream  sediment  gold 
 anomaly (Target A) and untested barium-rich gossans (Target B). 
 Conclusions: Both target areas will be investigated in detail during the next report period. 
 DISTRIBUTION LISTt: 
 Buxton Resources Limited 
 South Boulder Mines Ltd 
 WA Department of Industry and Resources

The Project consists of a granted Exploration Licence (E45/2768), covering an area of 112 
 km2  that  is  considered  prospective  for  shear  hosted  gold  mineralization  and  volcanogenic 
 massive sulphide mineralization.

29.text: iron  formation  (BIF).    The  BLEG  sample  returned  18.5  ppb  gold  and  this  is  considered

30.text: significant when compared with other BLEG stream samples collected in the district.  The

31.text: location of the anomalous gold sample is shown on Figure 5 with QuickBird Satellite Image

text:
Stream sediment sampling over the tenement area is sparse.  Nonetheless, an elevated gold 
 result was returned from a stream draining Fortescue Group and in the headwaters banded 
 iron  formation  (BIF).    The  BLEG  sample  returned  18.5  ppb  gold  and  this  is  considered 
 significant when compared with other BLEG stream samples collected in the district.  The 
 location of the anomalous gold sample is shown on Figure 5 with QuickBird Satellite Image 
 The  anomalous  gold  value may  be  related  to  auriferous  conglomerates  at  the  base  of  the 
 Fortescue  Group.    If  this  is  not  the  source  then  the  BIF  in  the  headwaters  needs  to  be 
 The  planned  work  program  will  involve  systematic  and  detailed  BLEG  stream  sediment 
 sampling  upstream  of  the  gold  anomaly.    Sampling  in  neighbouring  streams  will  also  be

62.text: The greenstone belt in the Project area is difficult to access and for this reason it is under-

63.text: explored even though the rock-types mapped in the district are considered prospective for

64.text: base  metal  and  gold.    Limited  work  by  past  explorers  has  identified  a  BLEG  stream

65.text: sediment  anomaly  (Target  A)  and  an  area  of  gossanous  rocks that  contain  highly  elevated

66.text: barium plus some patchy copper and zinc values (Target B).

68.text: The  Company  intends  to  evaluate  these  two  areas  by  surface  prospecting,  geochemical

 The greenstone belt in the Project area is difficult to access and for this reason it is under-
 explored even though the rock-types mapped in the district are considered prospective for 
 base  metal  and  gold.    Limited  work  by  past  explorers  has  identified  a  BLEG  stream 
 sediment  anomaly  (Target  A)  and  an  area  of  gossanous  rocks that  contain  highly  elevated 
 barium plus some patchy copper and zinc values (Target B). 
 The  Company  intends  to  evaluate  these  two  areas  by  surface  prospecting,  geochemical 
 sampling and reconnaissance geological mapping.
